subject: Travel
subcategory: The Story of Maps and Navigation
title: The Oldest Map in the World
description: A quick, practical guide to The Oldest Map in the World.

hook.text: The oldest known map is a 14,000-year-old cave painting in Spain. It shows a landscape and river routes.

buildup.text: Early humans scratched maps into bone, rock, and clay long before they invented writing.

discovery.text: A Babylonian clay tablet from 600 BC shows the world as a flat disc surrounded by ocean.

twist.text: The Babylonians placed their own city at the center of the world. Every culture did the same on their maps.

climax.text: Maps have always been as much about ego as geography. Whoever makes the map decides what's important.

punchline.text: Every civilization put itself at the center.

quiz.question: What is the oldest known map?
